SENT.plain: Monoclonal antibodies (McAb) to Ki-67, BrdU and OKT9 were used in APAAP technique for determining the proliferative cells of 46 myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) with 16 serving as normal controls
According to Ki-67 positive labelling, the proliferative fractions of bone marrow cells can be divided into low (< 25%), intermediate (25%-35%), and high (> 35%) grades
The labelling positivity of Ki-67, BrdU and OKT9 in MDS was all higher than that of the controls
Furthermore, the positive percentages of these three McAbs were significantly correlated
From the results of our experiment, an increase in proliferative fraction was related to clinical classification, prognosis, and therapy of MDS
On the other hand, the positive percentage of Ki-67 > 40% and BrdU > 30% or ratio of BrdU to Ki-67 > 80% may be considered as parameters for unfavourable prognosis
